recipes.title: Veggie Stew
recipes.method: Pre-heat the oven to 200C/3C/gas. Place the carrot, leek and tofu in a large bowl. Add the stock and mix well. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Place the mixture in a large bowl and cover with a lid. Place the lid on the oven and cook for 40 minutes. Serve with a slaw of your choice

recipes.title: Veggie Pizza
recipes.method: Pre-heat the oven to 200C/3C/gas. Add the pasata, green pepper and mushrooms to the base. Place the lid on the oven and cook for 30 minutes.  Serve with a slaw of your choice

recipes.title: Coban Salad
recipes.method: Simply mix together all the finely chopped vegetables and place them in the desired serving bowl. Stir together all the dressing ingredients. Taste and adjust if necessary then pour on top of the salad mixture.

recipes.title: Chickpea Curry
recipes.method: To make the paste, heat a little of the 2 tbsp oil in a frying pan, add 1 diced onion and 1 tsp fresh or dried chilli, and cook until softened, about 8 mins.In a food processor, combine 9 garlic cloves, a thumb-sized piece of peeled ginger and the remaining oil, then add 1 tbsp ground coriander, 2 tbsp ground cumin, 1 tbsp garam masala, 2 tbsp tomato purée, ½ tsp salt and the fried onion. Blend to a smooth paste – add a drop of water or more oil, if needed.Cook the paste in a medium saucepan for 2 mins over a medium-high heat, stirring occasionally so it doesn’t stick.Tip in two 400g cans drained chickpeas and a 400g can chopped tomatoes, and simmer for 5 mins until reduced down.Add 100g creamed coconut with a little water, cook for 5 mins more, then add ½ small pack chopped coriander and 100g spinach, and cook until wilted.Garnish with extra coriander and serve with rice or dhal (or both).
